main event: Multiple unidentified aerial objects were observed flying over Klamath Falls, Oregon on 23 June 1949 by several witnesses including CAA maintenance technicians and a housewife.
interesting points: The objects were oval in shape, approximately the size of a dinner plate, and grayish-white in color.
They left no exhaust trail, had no visible means of propulsion or support, and made no sound.
The objects maneuvered in a sharp turn to an easterly direction and faded from view due to distance.
Witnesses reported that the objects were traveling at speeds faster than any jet ever seen, and they changed flight direction rather rapidly.

One witness, who completed a course in aircraft identification in the Armed Forces, indicated that the objects appeared to be flying under high clouds and their means of support, lights, and method of propulsion were undetermined due to their altitude and size.
sighted object: multiple unidentified aerial objects in the sky
witnesses: Multiple witnesses including CAA maintenance technicians and a housewife
